intro: Cyclophorus micraster, commonly known as the small cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in temperate regions. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Cyclophorus micraster is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological preferences.
